result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas K Brzezinski

defendant.name: Brzezinski, Nicholas K
defendant.address: 4190 South Regal Drive, New Berlin, WI 53151

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas K Brzezinski not in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III appeared by video for Nicholas K Brzezinski.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for review hearing to address Justice Point violation. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court with held any decision on bail/bond. 
Case remains calendared for review hearing on 11-14-2022 at 1:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
DPA Violation Report, received and filed

Defendant Nicholas K Brzezinski in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Nicholas K Brzezinski.  Attorney Patrick Franken in court for Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status conference. Court advised parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNT 2 : Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas K Brzezinski in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Status conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.  TAD evaluation has been scheduled and Defense requests an adjourned Status Conference.
Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 17.

Defendant Nicholas K Brzezinski in court. Attorney Fred Richardson appeared via zoom.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas K Brzezinski in court, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Nicholas K Brzezinski in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/03/2022@2:30p
